channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Residents fed up with continuous fly tipping. Something MUST be done, 1st March
item.description:
Further to ref: 8985260 on 24 Feb, 8934082 on 16 Feb, 8914360 on 13 Feb, 8880708 on 10 Feb, 8849897 on 06 Feb, 8730739, 8676867, and 8682206, the issue of constant fly tipping, with black rubbish bags and other rubbish being left out in the communal pathway, continues unresolved week after week. This latest instance occurred sometime in the night of 28 Feb / early in the morning on 01 Mar. Attention to this matter to stop it from happening continuously multiple times a week, is urgently needed. In fact the problem is worsening week after week, day after day.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lucey Way, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car left flat tyre, 1st March
item.description:
This vechicle has been left here for over a month the parking is for residential only and no one has come to check the car its just been left with a flat tyre for almost 2 months taking up residential parking

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Prout Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Pathway light obscured by vegetation, 1st March
item.description:
The marked street light is actually built in to the boundary fence instead of in front of it. Hence is the laurel hedge is not pruned regularly the street light is partially obscured. The whole passageway has a lot of overhanging vegetation including a bramble which hangs down to face level in the summer and can scratch people’s faces. Partly due to the overhanging vegetation the path is covered in slippery moss apart from the central part of the path.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eastcote, Crofton, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street Friends Project please collect, 1st March
item.description:
Hi, I have put the two veolia bags on the top to dissuade any animals as there is food waste in the bags. Also a NOS cylinder Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cray Valley Road, Poverest, Greater London

item.title: Bins left out, overflowing and side rubbish, 1st March
item.description:
In the middle of Charlton Village Conservation Area, several bins in full view attracting side rubbish and more dumping. Unsightly. Needs a s93 notice against the negligent owner under the Environmental Protection Act.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): The Village, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned pallet. This is on public land. Not private., 1st March
item.description:
I previously reported this. This is on public land. Not private. It is on the public footpath and if it falls could injure passing pedestrians. The private land only starts inside the gate. This pallet has been abandoned OUTSIDE the gate. So this is the councils responsibility to clear.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Oglander Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lime Scooter dumped, 1st March

item.title: The entry and exit parts of the speed bump have eroded, 1st March
item.description:
On the raised section of the road where the speed bump starts, the raised portion has eroded causing a very very harsh impact on the Wheels of the cars. The same has happened for four or five of the speed bumps down this road I shall be reporting each one individual.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Main Road, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
